properties.Title: Dangerous Person - Amherst
properties.Summary:
Description: Amherst Police Department are responding a complaint in regards to a possible sighting of a person who may have been in possession of a firearm in the area of Church and East Pleasant St. Police have been in contact with local schools and are checking the areas for a person on a bicycle wearing a reddish/orange hoodie, sweatpants and a vest that resembled a ballistic vest. Police are asking that people in the Church Street/East Pleasant Street area to remain in their houses until further notice.
Expires: 2020-10-21T13:00:00-03:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Province of NS, 2020-10-20T13:13:47-03:00, 6B707DE0-FC50-C706-90BE-229DFBFC61D3
Area: Amherst, Nova Scotia
properties.Author: Province of NS

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A snowfall with 10 to 20 cm of accumulation is expected on Wednesday. Advancing cold air from the north will combine with an upper disturbance to produce snow along the Cypress Hills on Wednesday. Some areas of the Cypress Hills, especially near north-facing slopes, will likely see snowfall of 10 to 20 cm by the time the snow tapers off on Wednesday evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-22T01:46:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-21T09:47:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4205526797.2020

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls are expected to develop over southern sections of Great Slave Lake beginning late overnight into Wednesday. The squalls are expected to persist over the region into Thursday, with localized snowfall amounts possibly reaching or exceeding 25 cm by Thursday night. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-21T13:13:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-20T21:14:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3019527201.2020
Area: Ft. Resolution Region including Hwy. 6
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Snow at times heavy is expected to begin in southwestern portions of the province tonight and spread eastward towards the Cypress Hills by tomorrow morning. General snowfall accumulations of 10 cm are expected by Wednesday evening, however amounts may locally be higher near the Rockies and Cypress hills. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-21T13:15:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-20T21:16:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2333093750.2020
